CatDescriptText: John Kostopolis, North Hills and Carol Marusko, secretary, Monroeville, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 3, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Relative to the race riot in Montgomery, Ala., do you think the Federal Government should wait until a state asks for law enforcement help, or should the power of the United States be used immediately to protect a citizen's life when it is endangered?" John Kostopolis' answer reads: "I'll answer the question this way: The rights and privileges, not only of all citizens, irrespective of race, creed, or color, but of all people residing in the United States, should be protected and guaranteed their rights and privileges under due process of law."  Carol Marusko's answer reads: "I think the Federal Government should step right in to protect every one's equal rights.  The bus riots are ridicuious.  Everyone is equal to each other.  I think generally speaking that they are very prejudiced in the South..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of John Kostopolis wearing knitted coat, standing in front of window and wall with scroll; Portrait of Carol Marusko wearing patterned head scarf and gloves, carrying paper bag, standing on sidewalk with pedestrian and building in background
